messages.subject: Graffiti in the home
messages.msgSnippet: I don t know if anyone remembers a discussion from awhile back that was had over my daughter Megan being quite the little artist with the walls of the house.
messages.messageBody:
I don't know if anyone remembers a discussion from awhile back that
was had over my daughter Megan being quite the little artist with the
walls of the house. At one point, I said that if the house had been
our own, I'd let her have at the wall in one area and not worry about
it...but with everything going on at the time, just letting it be
wasn't an option (if you'll recall I was having monthly DSS visits
over other issues).

Back when we lived in Bermuda, my Uncle Pete came to live with us for
about a year. His girlfriend Robin, now his wife, came to visit for a
couple weeks.

Just before moving into our new apartment, we stayed with Uncle Pete
and Aunt Robin for a night. Robin and I had clicked right away when
we met years ago, and I'm thankful to be living close enough to visit
more often.

I'm rambling I think, but there is a point...when we went into the
entryway of their house, the sunporch, I found that the walls are
unfinished sheetrock with a few years' worth of "graffiti" on them!
It was one of those projects that kept seeming to get forgotten to be
finished, and they've decided NOT to finish them but rather keep the
artwork and such as it is!

:-) Cool, huh?

Elizabeth
